bibl.title: Charles Lind v. John F. Sheehan and H.G. Thornton. Petiton for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of the Third Judicial District of Washington Territory

body.p: In the District Court, of the Third Judicial District, holding terms at Port Townsend in Jefferson County
In the matter of the application of Charles Lind } Petition fpr For a Writ of Habeas Corpus Writ
To the Hon. R.S. Greene Judge of the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory.

Your petitoner says that he is restricted of his liberty in the Jail at Port Townsend Jefferson County W.T. by John F. Sheehan Sheriff of Jefferson County W.T. and H.G. Thornton a constable of King County Washington Territory.

That the cause and pretense of the restraint by said Sheehan is a telegram from the Chief of Police to him directing him to arrest said petitioner because he was indebted to P. Grubb and O. Johnson saloon keepers in the City of Seattle.

What the cause and pretense of the restraint by said Thornton is that he holds a warrant as Constable of King County directing him to arrest said petitioner in King County and not elsewhere on said warrant to answer an alleged
debt claimed to be owing from the petitoner to said P. Grubb and O Johnson.
What said restraint is illegal
Because said warrant held by Thornton does not authorize the arrest of petitioner in Jefferson County.
What said Justice had not authorization to issue said warrant because no bond was given as required by law and no proof was made before said Justice as required by law

Wherefore, Your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to said John F. Sheehan Sheriff, as aforesaid and said H.G. Thornton Constable as aforesaid, commanding them to have the body of said Charles Lind before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your Honor, concerning said Charles Lind, together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ, and that the said writ Charles Lind, may be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington County of Jefferson Charles Lind being duly sworn, says that he is the Petitioner in the above entitled action, that
he has heard read the foregoing petition and knows the contents thereof, and that the same is true of his own knowledge
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day } Charles Lind of August 1885
Morris B. Shacks Notary Public
In the Dist Court holding terms at Port Townsend.
In the matter of the application of Charles Lind for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
Filed August 24, 1885 James Seavey Clerk
Petition
W.H. White and Burdsham + Lacks attorneys for petitoner
